sentence.Network_en: Herbalism had become an all but extinct skill in the Western world.
sentence.Network_cn: 草药医术在西方已经成了一门几乎绝迹的技艺。

sentence.Network_en: Its tallest volcano, long extinct, is Olympus Mons.
sentence.Network_cn: 它最高的火山是早已熄灭的奥林波斯山。

sentence.Network_en: Servants are now almost extinct in modern society.
sentence.Network_cn: 在现代社会里奴仆已近乎不复存在。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'no longer alight'): from Latin exstinct- 'extinguished', from the verb exstinguere (see extinguish)

entry.def: A species of animal or plant that is extinct no longer has any living members, either in the world or in a particular place.

example.ex: It is 250 years since the wolf became extinct in Britain.
example.tran: 狼在英国已经灭绝250年了。

entry.tran: （某类劳动者、生活方式或活动）不复存在的，废除了的
entry.def: If a particular kind of worker, way of life, or type of activity is extinct, it no longer exists, because of changes in society.

example.ex: If the current trend continues, black farmers in the United States may be extinct by the end of this decade...
example.tran: 如果当前趋势继续发展下去，美国的黑人农民将在这个十年末不复存在。

example.ex: Herbalism had become an all but extinct skill in the Western world.
example.tran: 草药医术在西方已经成了一门几乎绝迹的技艺。

entry.def: An extinct volcano is one that does not erupt or is not expected to erupt any more.

example.ex: Its tallest volcano, long extinct, is Olympus Mons.
example.tran: 它最高的火山是早已熄灭的奥林波斯山。

means.word_mean: 1. no longer in existence; lost or especially having died out leaving no living representatives;
3. of a fire; being out or having grown cold;

sentences.sentence: "threw his extinct cigarette into the stream"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =prick,表示"刺,刺激"; 2. 引申为火焰

stems_affixes.value_cn: 清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+stinct刺,刺激→把刺分开→明显的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ive表形容词→adj.特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
instinct[n.本能,直觉,天性]+ive表形容词→adj.本能的
distinct清楚的,明显的+ly表副词→adv.清楚地, 显然

stems_affixes.value_cn: 区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ion表名词→n.区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
in内+stinct刺,刺激→内在的刺激,本能
in内+stig=stinct刺,刺激+ate使……→刺激别人内部→煽动

Sentence.sentence: Some polar animals will soon become extinct.

means.word_mean: （动植物，物种灭）灭绝的, 绝种的

sentences.en: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.cn: 恐龙绝种已有几百万年了。

means.word_mean: （某种类型的人或者生活方式，工作）消逝的, 破灭的

sentences.en: Nothing could rekindle her extinct passion.
sentences.cn: 她激情已逝, 无从心回意转。

jushi.english: Is there anything could rekindle his extinct passion?
jushi.chinese: 有什么事情可重燃他逝去的热情呢?

jushi.english: That was a fashion long extinct.
jushi.chinese: 那是早已不流行的样式。

jushi.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
